Calims Bane
Calimban Knoll, formerly called Calims Bane, was a stone circle marking where a battle was fought in the Calim Desert at the end of the Fourth Age of Calimshan.
Located near the northern border of the Calim Desert,  south of Memnon just off the Trade Way, Calimban Knoll was a circle of 21 menhirs  in diameter with a tiny, rocky mound in the center. The appearance of this site varied depending on conditions in the desert. At times, the hill was exposed at other times, sand covered the knoll, such that only the tops of the standing stones were visible. By 1370 DR, a third of the stones had toppled over.
The site memorialized where a small band of escaped slaves held off a full legion of Calishite soldiers in the Fourth Age of Calimshan.
Despite the passage of centuries, some magic seemed to preserve the menhirs, and Memnons Crackle was unable to disturb the site.
